post_text: Ms. Wozniak's class has been learning about how composting can help the Earth during remote learning. Through Google Classroom, they made a DIY compost bin, observed the changes to the bins over the last few weeks, and then used their compost mixture in their experiment. They planted one sunflower seed in plain soil and one seed in their compost and soil mixture. Ms. Wozniak delivered the sunflowers to her students yesterday. They will measure the plants to see which one grows taller. Great job to Ms. Wozniak and her students as they continue to learn and 'grow' during this time!

Letters from the Kankakee County Health Department are being sent home this afternoon with all the students of Bradley East due to another positive pertussis (whooping cough) being reported to us today. Please remember to keep your student home if they are sick to prevent spreading the illness to the others in the building. If your child has any of the signs and symptoms of pertussis, be sure to get them to their health care provider or fast care center as soon as possible so they may receive proper treatment.

Remember the best way to prevent the spread of pertussis and other illness this winter is the "Three C's".

*Clean hands - good frequent, hand washing with soap and water or if that's not available hand sanitizer will work also
*Covering our coughs and sneezes with a tissues or into our arm and never into our hands.
*Contain the illness - if we are ill or not feeling well, we need to stay home from work or school to rest and prevent exposing others to our illness.

Any question or concerns please contact Nurse Vaughn at 815-939-6603 or jvaughn@bradleyschools.com
